Album Review: Years & Years - Communion

Chris Agathangelou praises the intelligent, club-friendly debut effort of Olly Alexander and Co

Album Review: Tame Impala - Currents

'If you can get over that fact that you're more likely to hear keyboard riffs than guitar ones and groove rather than rock, it becomes apparent that at the core of this album are the very staples of a Tame Impala record'

Album Review: Lucy Rose - Work It Out

Work It Out is a comfortable though not especially bold follow up, writes Lily Papworth

On The Radar: The Maccabees, Raury, Darwin Deez, FTSE & Hannah Peel

Music Editor Chris Owen brings you five songs from five artists making a splash this week

Festivals 2015: Citadel - Day Review

An amiable atmosphere, innovative line-up and eclectic blend of entertainment combine to make the first Citadel a breath of fresh air in a saturated festival season

Album Review: Mika - No Place In Heaven

By James Bithell

In trying to sound more personal Mika has ended up sounding a bit dull, writes Daniel Bowen

Live Review: Ed Sheeran @ Wembley Stadium, London

By James Bithell

Amy Bishop attends as the global superstar sells out three nights at one of the UK's biggest and most prestigious spaces

Live Review: Modest Mouse @ O2 Academy, Leeds

Indie rock veterans Modest Mouse return for an unimpressive show at Leeds' 02 Academy, Ellie Langford writes.

Album Review: Wolf Alice - My Love Is Cool

By James Bithell

"My Love is Cool perfectly encapsulates the band's evolution, giving us the same slick riffs and grungy vibes but also more of their haunting, ethereal tracks"

Album Review: Florence + The Machine - How Big, How Blue, How Beautiful

By James Bithell

Florence's third album showcases some of her best moments but also some of her worst, writes Daniel Bowen

Album Review: Muse - Drones

Stadium-hopping British trio prove that they're done with interesting music once and for all (Or: Queen tribute act forget fourth member).

Album Review: God Damn - Vultures

By James Bithell

Black Country two-piece deliver a crushing debut album to fulfil the promise of numerous EPs.

Album Review: Brandon Flowers - The Desired Effect

By James Bithell

The Killers' frontman is back with his second solo effort - Jamie Summers weighs up The Desired Effect alongside 2010's Flamingo

Album Review: Keston Cobblers Club - Wildfire

By James Bithell

"Free from the crippling weight of popular expectation, the Cobblers have found themselves capable of soaring to dizzying heights of creation and innovation"

Album Review: Young Guns - Ones and Zeroes

By James Bithell

The alt-rockers' third album is far greater than the sum of its parts, writes V. S. Wells

Album Review: Django Django - Born Under Saturn

By James Bithell

Django Django have once again breathed a new lease of life into the art rock scene with Born Under Saturn, writes Emily McDonnell

Festivals 2015: Dot To Dot Nottingham - Day Review

By James Bithell

Chloe Kent and Munisha Lall head down to the Nottingham leg of the increasingly prolific touring festival, and catch sets from Rae Morris, Saint Raymond, Amber Run and Swim Deep

Album Review: Mumford & Sons - Wilder Mind

By James Bithell

Mumford and Sons' hypnotic control over the British audience continues. Alex Killeen reviews

Live Review & Interview: Funeral For A Friend @ York Duchess

The Welsh Rockers sit down with Beki Elmer after they bring their brand of melodic-hardcore to York

Live Review: Years & Years @ Fibbers, York

By James Bithell

Chris Owen reviews as Years & Years come to Fibbers to peddle their product down 300 smartphone lenses

Festivals 2015: Live at Leeds - Day Review

By James Bithell

The torrential drizzle may have dampened proceedings in Leeds, but the quality acts and dazzling diversity of Leeds' music venues made this festival one to remember

Album Review: Blur - The Magic Whip

By James Bithell

Liam Mullally is surprised but pleased by how well this unexpected Blur album pulls off a consolidation of an outstanding career

Album Review: Amber Run - 5AM

"With a mix of songs, ranging between the very sad to the euphoric, Amber Run have covered the whole spectrum, without losing their constantly heartfelt core"

Album Review: Villagers - Darling Arithmetic

Conor O'Brien a.k.a Villagers seems to have found a Paul Simon-esque ability to translate with disarming simplicity and honesty sentiments that hold universal resonance. Jonathon Hoare reviews

Album Review: Marina & The Diamonds - FROOT

Marina & The Diamonds new album restores reviewer Jack Elliott's faith in pop music

Album Review: The Wombats - Glitterbug

Save for a few flashes of character, Hatti Linnell finds the band's latest record largely bland and forgettable

Album Review: The Prodigy - The Day Is My Enemy

"What the hell happened" - Beki Elmer is left dumbfounded by an album that fails to deliver

Album Review: Mark Knopfler - Tracker

One time Dire Straits songsmith continues to plod through an unremarkable solo career. Ben Phillips reviews

Album Review: Madonna - Rebel Heart

Not the most listenable effort, but an intelligent album that lives up to expectations. Jack Elliott reviews

Album Review: The Cribs - For All My Sisters

The Cribs' first attempt at a full-on "Pop" album, is this their bid for that coveted headliner slot?
